event.title: possession of this portion of the Sangre de Cristo Land Grant on April 9, 1851

data.event: Hispanic settlers from the Taos Valley established several small villages along the Rio Culebra in the San Luis Valley and officially took possession of this portion of the Sangre de Cristo Land Grant on April 9, 1851.

event.title: dedicated it on the Feast of Saint Louis, June 21, 1851

data.event: Settlers built a church in the central village of La Plaza Medio and dedicated it on the Feast of Saint Louis, June 21, 1851.

event.title: remained part of the Territory of New Mexico until 1861

data.event: San Luis remained part of the Territory of New Mexico until 1861 when the Territory of Colorado was established.
